model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I'm the boss!
Yeah, we know. You don't have to remind us every five minutes.
I just want everything to go smoothly and according to plan.
I understand that, but it doesn't always have to be your way or the highway.
Well, I just think that my way is usually the best way.
And sometimes it is, but we all have different ideas and perspectives to bring to the table.
Okay, I see your point. I'll try to be more open-minded in the future.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Work Ethic and Helping Others', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A and Co-workers B discuss the importance of work ethic, helping others, and creating a positive work culture.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, have you noticed how people are always coming to me for help? ### Co-workers B: Yeah, actually, I have. You're known for being really competent. ### Co-workers A: Thanks. I just try to always do my best and make sure my work is top-notch. ### Co-workers B: It definitely shows. I've seen how people trust you with important projects because they know you'll get it done right. ### Co-workers A: That's the goal. And I actually really enjoy being able to help people out, too. ### Co-workers B: It's a great quality to have. You make the workplace better for everyone when you're always willing to lend a hand. ### Co-workers A: I think it just comes down to having a good work ethic. You know, it's important to take pride in what you do. ### Co-workers B: Absolutely. And I think that's something that rubs off on other people, too. When they see how much effort you put in, it motivates them to do the same. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, it's all about leading by example. And hopefully, it creates a positive culture where everyone strives to do their best. ### Co-workers A: Hey, I'm glad I could return your watch to you. It's good to see you happy again. ### Co-workers B: Thanks, I really appreciate you finding it. I was starting to think I lost it for good. ### Co-workers A: No problem at all. I knew it was important to you, and I wanted to help.  ### Co-workers B: You always seem to go above and beyond. You're so competent and reliable. ### Co-workers A: Thank you, that means a lot coming from you. I always strive to do my best. ### Co-workers B: That's why people come to you for help. They know you'll get the job done right. ### Co-workers A: Well, I try my best. Hey, speaking of helping each other, I'm glad we can be friends again after that disagreement we had. ### Co-workers B: Yeah, me too. It was silly to let that come between us. You're a good friend. ### Co-workers A: Likewise. It just proves that communication and understanding is key in any relationship, whether it's friendship or work-related. ### Co-workers B: Definitely. And I think that's something we both excel at- working well with others and resolving any issues that may arise. ### Co-workers A: Agreed. It's all about being competent in our skills and also our social interactions.' }
```

Brief explanation: The DIALOGUE CONTEXT revolves around a disagreement about leadership style and openness to other's ideas between Co-worker A and Co-worker B.
